parameters.name: Clarity & Professionalism
parameters.description: Responses are clear, well-structured, and professional.While also being personalized rather than generic or delivered in a robotic, template-like manner. Avoids unnecessary jargon.
guidelines: Must include a greeting that aligns with Pepperstone branding.
Greeting includes 'Thank you for contacting Pepperstone,' agent name, and an offer to assist (e.g., 'Thank you for contacting Pepperstone. I'm Doris, how may I assist you today?')
Bad example - Greeting is polite but lacks full branding (e.g., 'Hello, I'm Doris. How may I help you today?')
Bad example - Greeting is too short or generic (e.g., 'How may I support you?')
No greeting at all.

parameters.name: Grammar & Spelling
parameters.description: No typos or grammatical errors. Uses correct terminology.
guidelines: If any of the three mistakes above occur, this attribute is considered a Fail.
Lack of punctuation marks is also considered poor spelling.
The first letter of a sentence must be capitalized.
A period (.) is required at the end of a sentence.
A question mark (?) must be used for interrogative sentences.
Spelling errors in native language (e.g., 'Xin Chào' written as 'Xin Chòa') count as one mistake.
If CS realizes they made a spelling mistake, apologizes to the customer, and corrects it, the mistake can be skipped (Punctuation errors cannot be corrected).
1–3 mistakes: Full score. From 4 and above mistakes: Fail.

parameters.name: Tone & Empathy
parameters.description: Maintains a polite, friendly, and appropriate tone. Shows empathy in relevant situations.
guidelines: Empathy Must be shown when the customer faces issues or feels frustrated.
Example of Empathy: 'I completely understand how frustrating this must be, and I sincerely apologize for the delay. Let me check the status for you right away.'
Balanced tone between formal and conversational.
Avoid overly direct or informal responses (e.g., 'Send me the details, and I will check.' or 'Hey there! No worries, I'll check for you now.')

parameters.name: Active Listening
parameters.description: Acknowledges client concerns and provides relevant, personalized Responses instead of generic ones.
guidelines: If a CS agent overlooks the customer's question or issue and asks again, it is considered a failure in Active Listening.
The customer asked two questions but the agent only responded to one.
If agent does not fail active listening as mentioned above, get full score.

Proactively reviews the chat history with the bot without needing to ask customer again if they have already addressed the inquiries Or If the customer has already mentioned a question in the chat but the CS overlooks it and asks again, it will be considered a lapse in active listening.

parameters.name: Accuracy of Response
parameters.description: Information provided is factually correct and aligns with company policies & trading regulations.
guidelines: If the client has asked only one question and the agent answers it correctly, give full score.
If the client has asked only one question and the agent answers it incorrectly/missing, give zero score.
The scoring should be based on the percentage of questions answered correctly.
For example, if the client asked 4 questions and the agent answered 3 correctly, the score would be 75%.
When a customer asks a question covered in the Knowledge Base, the agent's answer should contain the key information from the KB.
Agent should not contradict information in the Knowledge Base.
For questions not covered in the KB, score should be based on general accuracy and compliance with policies.
Agent may personalize KB answers but must maintain the core information and policy details.
Give full score when answers align with KB information, even if not verbatim.
If the agent's answer is correct but not aligned with the KB, score should be based on overall accuracy and compliance with policies.

parameters.name: Compliance with Internal & Regulatory Policies
parameters.description: Adheres to internal guidelines, AML/KYC requirements, and financial industry regulations.
guidelines: Before providing any account-related information, CS must complete the identification process based on low-risk or high-risk categories.
For low-risk questions: The agent verifies the customer using an SMS code.
For high-risk & maximum risk questions: The agent verifies the customer using three methods—SMS code confirmation, date of birth, and username.
Cannot share one client's information with another (except when an IB inquires about their downline, following the process).

parameters.name: Probing & Clarification
parameters.description: Uses effective probing questions to identify the client's issue accurately.
guidelines: Uses effective probing questions to identify the client's issue accurately.
Examples of probing questions: 'Could you confirm the transaction ID?', 'Can you specify the exact issue you're facing?'

parameters.name: Troubleshooting
parameters.description: Provides appropriate troubleshooting based on understanding the issue; basic troubleshooting must be completed before escalation.
guidelines: Basic troubleshooting steps must be completed before escalating the issue.
Example: 'Let me check your account details and verify if everything is in order.'

parameters.name: Handling Time
parameters.description: Resolves issues efficiently without unnecessary delays.
guidelines: Basic inquiries: Maximum 2 holds (3–5 mins each), total hold time ≤10 mins.
Complex inquiries/issues: Maximum 3 holds, total hold time ≤15 mins.
If unresolved within 15 mins, follow up via email.
If the CS asks the customer to wait 3–5 minutes but only responds after 7 minutes, the score for this attribute will be zero

parameters.name: Ensuring Complete Resolution + Additional Help Offered
parameters.description: Acknowledges client concerns and provides relevant, prompt responses proactively.
guidelines: 3 + 3 minutes rules applies when client is away / we have not provided solution / pending for client information.

Ex: Could you provide me XXX? After 3 mins: May I check if you are still connected with us? After another 3 mins: It seems you're busy at the moment. If you need any assistance later, please feel free to reach out. I'll go ahead and close this chat window now. Have a nice day!

3 minutes rule is applied when we have provided answer to client's enquiries. Example: For your inquiry, after I check, you can..... (wait a moment for customer reading) then 'Is there anything else that you want me to assist?' If the customer does not reply within 3 minutes after being asked this question, CS can proceed to close the chat using the normal closing script and pitch the survey.

All points here must strictly follow the 3 or 3+3 rule and after providing any answer, we must always ask: 'Is there anything else I could help you with?' For example, if a customer asks 3 questions, after answering each one, we need to ask this additional-help question before proceeding with the closing procedure.
If any step is skipped (3 mins or additional help question), it will be considered as rushing to close the support window, and no score will be given for this attribute.

parameters.name: Chat Documentation
parameters.description: Logs key details accurately in internal note (if needed) for future reference.
guidelines: Logs key details accurately in internal notes for future reference.
Include timestamps, customer queries, and resolutions.
Example - need to escalate to Ops, take note  the Ops ticket in internal note

parameters.name: Pitch Survey
parameters.description: Pitch the survey for any chat where information or a solution has already been provided. (For escalated chats, do not include this part.)
guidelines: Survey must be pitched for all chats where information or solution has been provided to the customer.
Do NOT pitch survey for escalated chats or cases that require further follow-up.
Agent must explicitly ask for customer feedback before closing the chat.
Agent should encourage rating by mentioning it helps improve service quality.

parameters.name: Tagging & Categorization
parameters.description: Uses the correct tags or categories for accurate reporting and case tracking, including system-level categorization.
guidelines: Check for system-level categorization in chat headers (e.g., 'Chat reason: General Query')
Evaluate agent-applied tags within the conversation
Look for proper issue type identification and resolution categorization
Examples of agent tags: 'Withdrawal Issue', 'Login Problem', 'Trade Execution Query'
System categories like 'General Query', 'Technical Support', 'Account Issue' count as proper categorization
Scoring: 85-94 when system category is present, 95-100 when system + agent tagging both present

excellent.description: Perfect execution that meets all requirements

very_good.description: Excellent work with minor enhancement opportunities

fair.description: Adequate service with notable room for improvement
